enrollment.header--FRHFRM: Inclusion dans la facturation Insuffisance cardiaque
enrollment.label: Le patient est déjà inclus dans le programme  {{programName}}. Le cycle de facturation en cours a débuté le {{cycleStart}} et se termine le {{cycleEnd}}.

option-1.label: Attendre la fin du cycle en cours et passer le patient sous le nouveau forfait après le {{cycleEnd}}

option-2.label: Ne pas attendre la fin du cycle en cours et passer le patient sous le nouveau forfait dès le {{cycleStart}}

FRHFRM.agreement: En validant vous confirmez avoir pris connaissance de ces informations.
FRHFRM.comorbidities--1: Cancer sous traitement systémique ou traitement par radiothérapie.
FRHFRM.comorbidities--2: Insuffisance rénale chronique (uniquement stades 4 et 5 soit DFG < 45 ml/min/1,73 m2).
FRHFRM.comorbidities--3: Anémie sévère ou carence martiale sévère
FRHFRM.comorbidities--4: Dénutrition sévère associée à une anémie sidéroblastique ou une malnutrition protéino-énergetique grave.

eligibility-requirements.label: Ci-dessous sont listées les conditions permettant de déterminer l'éligibilité d’un patient aux différents forfaits.

FRHFRM.package--TVB: Le forfait de base (code TVB à 28€ par patient par mois)

package--TVB2.5: Le forfait majoré niveau 2  (code TVB 2,5 à 70€ par patient par mois)

package.title: 3 forfaits sont disponibles pour l’insuffisance cardiaque.

TVB.eligibility-requirements--1: Hospitalisation au cours des 12 derniers mois pour une poussée d’insuffisance cardiaque
TVB.eligibility-requirements--2: Actuellement en classe NYHA 2 ou plus avec un taux de peptides natriurétiques élevé (BNP > 100 pg/mL ou NT pro BNP > 1000 pg/mL)

5.eligibility-requirements--1: Patients âgés de 80 ans ou plus atteints d'au moins deux comorbidités listées ci-dessous.
5.eligibility-requirements--2: Patients âgés de moins de 80 ans atteints d'au moins trois comorbidités listées ci-dessous.

eligibility-requirements--3.cardiac-amyloidosis: Amylose cardiaque, en sortie d'hospitalisation avec insuffisance cardiaque correspondant a minima au stade II NYHA.
eligibility-requirements--3.dialysis: Syndrome cardio-rénal et en attente de dialyse.
eligibility-requirements--3.last-6-months: Victime d'un choc cardiogénique dans les 6 derniers mois.
eligibility-requirements--3.refractory-heart-failure: Insuffisance cardiaque réfractaire et dont le pronostic vital est inférieur à une année.
eligibility-requirements--3.restrictive-cardiomyopathy: Cardiomyopathie restrictive, en sortie d'hospitalisation avec insuffisance cardiaque correspondant a minima au stade II NYHA.
eligibility-requirements--3.waiting-list: Inscrit sur la liste d'attente pour transplantation cardiaque.

TVB2.eligibility-requirements--1: Patients âgés de 80 ans ou plus atteints d'au moins une comorbidité listée ci-dessous.
TVB2.eligibility-requirements--2: Patients âgés de moins de 80 ans atteints d'au moins deux comorbidités listées ci-dessous.
TVB2.eligibility-requirements--3: Patients hospitalisés dans les 30 derniers jours pour décompensation cardiaque.

FRHFRM.warning: Un patient ne peut être facturé pour plusieurs forfaits à la fois. Si vous souhaitez inclure ce patient dans un des trois programmes, il sera automatiquement sorti de tout autre programme de facturation pour l'insuffisance cardiaque.

IM008_description:
SignalHF is intended to be used by qualified healthcare professionals (HCPs) as adjunctive information when remotely managing heart failure patients by providing a  HF score based on cardiac parameters. The device is designed to be used with physiological data from compatible and patient pre-existing sensors such as cardiac implanted electronic devices (e.g. heart rate, patient activity, thoracic impedance, etc.) along with available clinical parameters (e.g. demographics, comorbidities, and medication).
SignalHF provides adjunctive information enabling assessment of patients’ potential heart failure status and risk of a worsening condition or hospitalization related to heart failure.
SignalHF provides adjunct information for qualified HCPs to use in conjunction with clinical evaluation that is part of standard clinical practice and should not replace standard of care treatment.
For more information, refer to the Instructions for Use

IM008_title.not-available: IM008 SignalHF (Not available in the EU for the moment)

IM009_description:
IM009 is a software as a medical device (SaMD) intended to be used as an adjunct of a remote monitoring platform to follow-up target population patients.
IM009 is compatible with devices with remote monitoring feature such as:
  • cardiac implantable electronic devices
  • connected weight scales

The three main intents of IM009 are to:
  • Label observations generated by medical devices according to predefined categories.
  • Create clinically relevant observations for worsening atrial fibrillation and/or rapid weight gain in the context of heart failure, based on data recorded by the device.
  • Label Atrial Fibrillation burden observations generated by cardiac implantable electronic device (CIED) as to be hidden or relevant for health care provider based on patient’s anticoagulation status.

Hence, IM009 is designed to reduce the workload burden of healthcare providers/professionals in charge of reviewing the observations received from the patients’ devices.
IM009 is not intended for use:
  • in life supporting or sustaining systems or Alarm devices.
  • as a solely means of diagnosis. It is offered to healthcare providers/professionals on an advisory basis only in conjunction with the physician’s knowledge of ECG patterns, patient background, clinical history, symptoms, and other diagnostic information.

For more information, refer to the Instructions for Use

question.fatigue: Over the past 2 weeks, how many times has fatigue limited your ability to do what you wanted?
question.heart-failure-hurrying: Please indicate how much you have been limited by heart failure in your ability to do the following activity over the past 2 weeks: jogging or hurrying (as if to catch a bus)?
question.heart-failure-life-feeling: If you had to spend the rest of your life with your heart failure the way it is right now, how would you feel about it?
question.heart-failure-limitation: Over past 2 weeks how much has your heart failure limited your enjoyment of life?
question.heart-failure-participation-limiting-hob: How much does heart failure affect your lifestyle by limiting your participation the following activity over the past 2 weeks: Hobbies, recreational activities?
question.heart-failure-participation-limiting-vis: How much does heart failure affect your lifestyle by limiting your participation the following activity over the past 2 weeks: Visiting family or friends out of your home?
question.heart-failure-participation-limiting-wor: How much does heart failure affect your lifestyle by limiting your participation the following activity over the past 2 weeks: Working or doing household chores?
question.heart-failure-showering: Please indicate how much you have been limited by heart failure in your ability to do the following activity over the past 2 weeks: Showering/Bathing?
question.heart-failure-walking: Please indicate how much you have been limited by heart failure in your ability to do the following activity over the past 2 weeks: Walking 1 block on level ground?
question.short-breath-effort: Over the past 2 weeks, how many times has shortness of breath limited your ability to do what you wanted?
question.short-breath-pillow: Over the past 2 weeks on average, how many times have you been forced to sleep sitting up in a chair, or with at least 3 pillows to prop you because of shortness of breath?
question.swelling: Over the past 2 weeks, how many times did you have swelling in your feet, ankles or legs when you woke up in the morning?

questions.info: The following questions refer to your heart failure and how it may affect your life. Please read and complete the following questions. There are no right or wrong answers. Please mark the answer that best applies to you.

scroll.info: You might have to scroll to view some answers.

modal.warning: Warning: Implicity recommends using presets that have been chosen to send you relevant alerts. Changing the settings will alter the performance of the algorithm and may result in a loss of sensitivity or specificity. Risks include missing a heart failure event in one of your patients, or receiving irrelevant alerts.

connectivity_issue.data_received: A new transmission has been received for your cardiac implant. Your physician can now look after you from the distance!
connectivity_issue.initial: Hello {{patientTitle}} {{patientLastName}}, The transmitter linked to your cardiac implant is no longer sending data to your physician. It may be because you've been away from your home, or because your transmitter has been unplugged. Follow this link to reach out to the Remote Monitoring Team or to get assistance from the device manufacturer: {{- link}} The Remote Monitoring Team at {{medicalCenterName}}

heart_failure.initial: Hello {{patientTitle}} {{patientLastName}}, How do you feel today? Follow this link to give an update about your heart to the Remote Monitoring Team. {{- link}} The Remote Monitoring Team at {{medicalCenterName}}
heart_failure.reminder: Hello {{patientTitle}} {{patientLastName}}, We are waiting for your answers regarding your state of health. How do you feel today? Follow this link to give an update about your heart to the Remote Monitoring Team. {{- link}} The Remote Monitoring Team at {{medicalCenterName}}

prom.initial: Bonjour {{patientTitle}} {{patientLastName}}, l'équipe de {{medicalCenterName}} participe à une étude de recherche sur la télécardiologie. Suivez ce lien pour participer à l’étude en répondant à un court questionnaire sur votre insuffisance cardiaque : {{- link}}

reason.congestion_duration_above_threshold: This symptoms form was sent automatically based on the patient’s cardiac implant data, which has detected a congestion duration above threshold.
reason.hf_algo: This symptoms form was sent automatically based on the patient’s cardiac implant data, which has sent an alert for potential worsening heart failure.
reason.lung_overload_possible: This symptoms form was sent automatically based on the patient’s cardiac implant data, which indicated a possible lung overload for this patient.
reason.mean_pvc_per_hour_gt: This symptoms form was sent automatically based on the patient’s cardiac implant data, which detected that the patient’s PVC/h surpassed the threshold.
reason.rapid_weight_gain: This symptoms form was sent automatically based on the patient’s weight data.
reason.regular: This is a regularly scheduled symptoms form. This patient is scheduled to receive symptoms form every
reason.weight_loss: This symptoms form was sent automatically based on the patient’s weight loss. Find out more.

info.default: Simulation of the impact of your parameters: {{alertNumber}} alerts per patient per year. This is the Implicity recommended algorithm parameters.
info.equal: Simulation of the impact of your parameters: {{alertNumber}} alerts per patient-year. That is the same amount of alerts per patient-year than the Implicity recommended algorithm.
info.less: Simulation of the impact of your parameters: {{alertNumber}} alerts per patient-year. That is {{moreAlertNumber}} fewer alerts per patient-year than the Implicity recommended algorithm.
info.more: Simulation of the impact of your parameters: {{alertNumber}} alerts per patient-year. That is {{moreAlertNumber}} more alerts per patient-year than the Implicity recommended algorithm.
